DOC.HEAD: Explosion at Clandestine Gunpowder Factory Kills 4
DOC.TEXT: A clandestine gunpowder factory exploded in northeastern Brazil on Tuesday, killing four people, injuring more than 100 and destroying nearby homes, a fire department official said. Fire department workers dragged more than 100 people from the wreckage of their homes after the 8 a.m. blast, said Sgt. Pedro Oliveira Filho in an interview from the city of Feira de Santana, 960 miles northeast of Rio. Several of the more badly injured were hospitalized in critical condition. The TV Globo network showed scenes of houses near the factory reduced to rubble and trees flattened. ``When I heard the explosion I remembered God because I thought everyone was dead,'' said a woman identified as Maria Jose, who was injured in the blast. The factory, which had been operating for five months, had a sign out front identifying it as an auto repair shop, Globo reported.
